snippet: A new poll finds President Obama faring well against potential Republican candidates among independents and other voter groups that largely rejected Congressional Democrats in 2010.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll shows that Pres Obama, despite being locked in a tight race for re-election overall, is faring well against the top Republican candidates among independents and younger voters, two important groups that had abandoned Congressional Democrats in the 2010 midterm election.
lead_paragraph: A new poll finds President Obama faring well against potential Republican candidates among independents and other voter groups that largely rejected Congressional Democrats in 2010.

headline.seo: Obama Polling Better Among Independents, Times/CBS News Poll Finds
headline.main: President Recapturing Groups Won by G.O.P. in 2010
headline.print_headline: President Recapturing Groups That Backed G.O.P. in 2010
